Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, scruffy, tatty hotel in need of refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: FamilyInnes
Reviews.Content: We stayed in two junior suites in Le Placide last weekend. I wish we had not. The photos on the hotel website were obviously taken a long time ago and our two rooms were now very run down - horrible stains on the wallpaper, lots of rips and damage to the wall paper and chipped furniture and window frames. One of the bathrooms did not have a shower screen so we all had to shower in one room. It also had horrible brown damp patches and peeling flaking paint on the ceiling, dirty window frames and big stains on the floor tiles. The brown velvet curtains separating the bedrooms from the bathrooms were dirty and stained, the wine glasses in our room were very dusty, light bulbs had gone and not been replaced.... I could go on and on. In addition the extra roll out bed we had paid for for our third child was not there so we had to chase for it. The downstairs outdoor terrace which looks so pretty on the website has had all flowers and attractive decorative items removed and was being used as a store for staff scooters. All in all the worst hotel we have ever stayed in - a two star experience at rip off four star prices!

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Diana P
Reviews.Content: Small and cozy hotel, very well situated in a nice neighborhood! Lots of restaurants and cafés , close to metro stations, and Bon Marchée. We really enjoyed staying in this part of Paris!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Richard M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Le Placide this weekend. The staff, Christophe in particular, helped us with everything that we wanted, from an adaptor to booking restaurants. The rooms are adequate in size, bathroom beautiful, We didnt have breakfast as too much to do, but looked a good selection. It is located in a lovely area, near Le Bon Marche and within 5 minutes walk of four metro stations so very easy to get about Paris. Only thing missing, tea/ coffee tray, but really a minor issue. Would stay here again and strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in the heart of Saint Germain”
Reviews.Author: Carolina C
Reviews.Content: The Placide is a nice boutique hotel - the only downsize is that it lacks a bit of atmosphere ... the rooms are well decorated but in need of a bit of TLC ... and they are much smaller and not as airy and bright as they appear in the website. Concierge was not very helpful on our stay even forgetting to check on some reservations that we had asked on the night before ... and they seemed not to have much local knowledge of basic cafes and restaurants around ... The location is superb almost on the corner of one of the main boulevards and with Le Bon Marche - one of Paris biggest department stores just across the road. I stayed in quite a few other hotels in Paris and think that even knowing that the hotel Le Placide is nice you can find a much better deal for the amount of money you pay here - we stayed in a Junior suite.

Reviews.Title: “Everything a boutique hotel should be”
Reviews.Author: Saskia D
Reviews.Content: This hotel satisfies all the criteria for a proper boutique hotel. Superb location with metro station less than 5 mins walk away. Wonderful staff who really do make you feel welcome in a personal way without crowding you out. Great help in securing restaurant tables and good recommendations for alternatives (probably better than original choices in fact :) Comfy beds! Would highly recommend and will definitely book again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Le Placide”
Reviews.Author: LJKLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed overninght at Le Placide. Lovely boutique hotel in a fantastic position. Rooms are cool and very luxurious, staff were excellent ! Would strongly recommend

Reviews.Title: “awesome boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: helen s
Reviews.Content: Great location & excellent service by the people who work there, very friendly and attentive! Very small and quaint. Near many cool bistros and good shopping. Walking distance to everything (and metro). Would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great location for true French culture and away from the commercial areas.

Reviews.Title: “Cancellation Policy”
Reviews.Author: Julia M
Reviews.Content: Well - difficult to write a review of this hotel as we didn't actually get to stay there! Their cancellation policy is 5 days before your stay - which I did know when booking. However, excactly five days before our stay fell on a Sunday and I had booked through Mr and Mrs Smith which is closed on Sundays and so I sent an e-mail saying we needed to amend our booking and then called Mr and Mrs Smith as soon as they opened on Monday. I was told that the hotel had a very strict cancellation policy and that no matter what I would have to pay the full £345 for a room I wasn't going to stay in despite the fact they had 5 full working days to sell the room again. I asked if it was possible just change the date to still stay at that hotel - no flexibility there either. Also, I asked if they sold the room again whether I could then get a refund but no chance of that either. I was simply advised to try my travel insurance. Not impressed by either Le Placide or Mrs and Mrs Smith. Yes, I knew there was a 5 day cancellation policy so I do take responsibility for that but the fact that I couldn't contact the booking agent on a Sunday made it impossible for me to give the required notice. Big thumbs down for the hotel and Mr and Mrs Smith. They won't be getting my business again.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: MadameB65
Reviews.Content: A very small, personal, perfectly located hotel in St. Germain, Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Chic Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cat241
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 5 nights. The staff were helpful and nice. The room it self was very nicely decorated. We got the room with the balcony and that was very nice treat to sit out on in the evenings and enjoy a glass a wine. Although the room is on the small side it did suit our needs. The bathroom was large and the bathtub was amazing. I would enjoy a soak in the tub every evening. The area was beautiful - close to the subway - close to a grocery store and there is a Italian restaurant just across the rue that was friendly and yummy.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved This Hotel and will absolutely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Genevieve2011
Reviews.Content: Our family just spent a week in Paris. We found hotel Le Placide on line. We loved this hotel. It is in a great location (across the street from Bon Marche and the Rue de Bac and very close to 2 metro stops). The staff could not be nicer or more helpful. They made great restaurant and museum recommendations that were off the beaten path. The rooms are small as most Paris hotel rooms are but they are well designed and very comfortable. The only knock I have is that it can be a little loud with noise from the room above and/or the street. That said we will absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint boutique hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Audera
Reviews.Content: Le Placide is a small, quaint boutique hotel with just 18 rooms. Apparently, each room has a different color theme and mine was red. The room and bathroom were huge by Paris standards, with a window that opens into the street below. As it was a side road, I didn't find it noisy. The room was so spacious it easily fit a double bed, a couch and 2 cabinets for clothes and other stuff and still leave space to walk around. The bathroom was easily two-thirds the size of the bedroom. Due to the design of the bath nozzle, it wasn't easy to keep the floor dry. A fatal design flaw was the faucet knob. There were completely no grooves so forget about trying to turn it with your soapy wet hands. Unlike a large impersonal hotel chain, the advantage of staying in a small boutique is the personalized touch. At 11pm, the concierge managed to dig up a tube of sample toothpaste for my emergency use. Needless to say, they were also very helpful with maps and directions. Situated in between 2 metro stations and just opposite Le Bon Marche, it's a great location on the south bank to explore Paris from. Great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic and well appointed room”
Reviews.Author: Jessie187054
Reviews.Content: Booked Le Placide for my 40th birthday, expensive but we felt it was lovely for a special treat. Quirky tiny lift and beautiful room, very comfy bed

Reviews.Title: “A stylish, well designed boutique hotel a stone's throw from the fabulous Bon Marche stores.”
Reviews.Author: Moorish71
Reviews.Content: Very helpful staff. Pleasing attention to detail with service and design. Excellent value for money. However, if budget is of concern, I'd recommend breakfasting elsewhere as this seemed over-priced and there are many cheaper, charming alternatives nearby.

Reviews.Title: “A different one”
Reviews.Author: ScaccoMatto74
Reviews.Content: We liked this hotel especially because is very different from the traditional hotels you can find in Paris. Each floor has only 2 rooms. Each room has a huge "open" bathroom aprox of the same size of the rest of the room. Furnitures are glamour, trendy, modern and .....white!!!!. Good service and decent breakfast. A bit expensive but ok if you want to try something "fresh"!

Reviews.Title: “A nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: cristeena
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 nights during fashion week and we were pleased with it. We felt very cosy. It was like being home. The rooms are very nicely decorated. I loved the wallpaper which was very relaxing. The bathroom was nice and so was the bedroom. We could hear our neighbours at times, but it is to be expected when you stay in small boutique hotels! The owner of the hotel is a very lovely lady and is always available to help you and answer your questions! We didn't have any breakfast there as we love going around in parisians cafes for breakfast! It's only 7 minutes from the famous Cafe Flore and the location is great. It's in the middle of St Germain, and just opposite of Le Bon Marche (which was very convenient for last minute fashion crisis). You get free internet which was very convenient for working. It was a bit expensive and would love to have paid a bit less...but what do you expect? It's Paris, it's a boutique hotel, it's nicely decorated and its location is good. You gotta pay a price for the life you choose. :)

Reviews.Title: “Don't know if this place is a real 4 stars hotel. To avoid!!!”
Reviews.Author: j1965
Reviews.Content: My wife, my daughter and stayed in the hotel a couple of times as we liked its location but this time we have been really disappointed with many things: - the level of service is completely poor as due to a late arrival of our flight to Paris, we checked in at 1.30am and we have requested a couple of sandwiches but we got two pieces of bread with some slices of hams not even fresh. - the breakfast (22 euros per person) is the worst breakfast I have seen in my entire life. The cold cuts were simply rotten. No bread available in the morning, croissants were dry and really too expensive for the quality and quantity of food. Avoid the breakfast in this hotel. Go out and turn to the left twice and you have a breakfast deal for 10 euros. Much better. - Noisy, noisy and really noisy. We heared doors cracking every single minute and even with the ear plugs you can hear everything: metro (all night in the weekends), street's noise, people in the other rooms, chairs moving and cleaning people. - Maintenance very weak: every fourniture in the room had a problem and we could see that the level of maintenance was low. The television was in black and white!!!!! - Size of the junior suite is simply ridiculous. When you are three persons in the room, you can't even move around. In conclusion, the owner of this hotel is really abusing to charge almost 444 euros per night for three persons in a junior suite (following their standards) with such poor service, breakfast, size of the room and noises. I don't recommend this hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Zarza3
Reviews.Content: We had an absolutely brilliant weekend at Le Placide. All senses where catered for; the room was beautifully decorated and the view from the balcony was for Parisienne standards fine; the soft, plush and crisp bed linen was fabulous; the smell of the Molton Brown toiletries was out of this world; and as for the sense of hearing, well it was heavenly quiet! I would definately return and would recommend it to anyone and encourage you to stay there. A romantic weekend in Paris at its best.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasit hotel in great location and lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: carolinecat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited this hotel to celebrate his 50th birthday and we weren't disappointed. The location is great, very handy for the Metro and for some fantastic restaurants. The hotel itself was immaculate with very welcoming staff. Our room had a balcony on the fifth floor which was lovely to sit out on in the evening and relax before hitting the local restaurants! We had a large bathroom with a large natural window. Milton Brown products were for our use and we had lovely white fluffy towels and lots of light. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a lovely romantic long weekend in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and modern rooms with convenient location”
Reviews.Author: wegoaroundtheworld
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on a quiet street across from Le Bon Marche – makes it a very convenient spot to find. The hotel is definitely a boutique hotel – the “lobby” is really just the front desk and there is no where to store your luggage (we checked in early and our room was not ready but they offered to watch out luggage – they put it aside). We looked for a hotel in the St. Germaine district and were happy to find Le Placid, located next to Le Bon Marche but on a quiet street away from the noise. The hotel is small but modern – only 2 rooms per floor, with a tiny elevator (as others have mentioned). We found the room spacious for Paris with a big bathroom (bathtub and plenty of counter space) and its own window! There was free internet in the room (LAN and wireless). Although we did not really need it, the air conditioning was strong which we suspect will be helpful in the summer months. There was no smoking in the hotel although we did find an ashtray in the room – thankfully no smell of smoke! Beware the ground floor room is actually a duplex and different shaped than the other floors. Breakfast smelled good although we never tried it – there was a quick pastry shop down the street. Front desk service during the day was pleasant and helpful, and we asked for recommendations to dinner each night. He spoke good English and we did not have a problem conversing. The night desk person was odd and not very helpful – he did not note our morning wake-up call and many times was chatting in a side room and did not open the door for us. He also phoned a taxi for us but oddly enough the taxi charged us 7 euros for driving TO us. All in all, a bit expensive but we were happy with the room size and cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Two star hotel at four star prices”
Reviews.Author: PolarBear33
Reviews.Content: I was suspicious of the many great ratings below from first time reviewers and I wish I had followed my suspicions to another hotel. Le Placide felt like a two star establishment that arbitraged its way into four stars (and a much higher price) by throwing in some fancy soaps, a mini bar and safe. The front desk and rooms don't feel like either a hotel or cool boutique establishment. My room was spacious, but the closets were something out of Ikea and there was a leather couch that was darkened with years of grime. The night stand had a cigarette burn and the desk was awkwardly lined with pictures of movie stars. The bathrooms were also spacious, but there's no shower. In terms of location, the hotel is conveniently situated on the left bank, but the street it's located on is a little on the seedy side in my view. This was not the cool boutique hotel we were expecting for our Paris vacation, and we actually left for another hotel after our first night. For only a modest increase in rate, we found a far more luxurious establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: NvD
Reviews.Content: I very much enjoyed my 4 nights' stay at Le Placide. The rooms are spacy to Paris' standards, nicely decorated and bright, as there are windows on both sides of the room. The staff is very friendly and helpful yet not intrusive. I had a booked my room through the hotel's own website, which offered me a good deal (business package including breakfast - a better deal than through regular hotelbooking sites). The hotel only has 11 rooms, of which the one on the ground floor I believe is for the disabled and which is smaller. The other 10 rooms are divided over 5 floors, which means there are only two rooms on each floor (with a tiny elevator in the middle) - and each floor has its own decoration theme. My room on the fourth floor had walls with a black and white tree patterned paper and colored Kenzo cushions and bedspread, which looked cheerful but was a bit loud to my liking. The bed was good, the pillows were a bit too firm for me. There was a business desk in my room with a free internet connection that worked without any problem, which was pleasant and which is not for granted in Paris. I was informed by the hotel that the rooms on the top floor (fifth floor) do not have this business desk but instead have a small balcony. The bathroom is sufficiently spacious. My only point of criticism here would be that the showernob cannot be fixed to the wall, leaving no option but to sit in the bath tub showering (or simply take a bath). My booking included a "simple French breakfast" in my room every morning. I know what French breakfast usually means and was very pleased to find that at this hotel, the breakfast also included fresh fruit, freshly pressed juice, yoghurt and a range of bread rolls, pies and croissants. The location is good. Several metro stations are nearby. Up to the north and west is the 7th district, which is slightly less touristic, and up to the east is St-Germain. It is a neighbourhood where a woman can walk around at night alone without being bothered or feeling unsafe.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: Jeannie H
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a stay in this hotel and I cannot say enough about the helpfulness of the staff -- and the great location. Our flight was cancelled due to the volcano eruption and our group was struggling to get home to the United States. Simultaneously, there was a train strike in France. Our concierge, Christopher, actually walked us to the train station and to the rental car agency to try and find tickets and/or a car (no luck). He was incredibly helpful, as was Marie and Bertrand. Eventually, the hotel staff located a private car service to transport us to Madrid, one of the only functionning airports in Europe, where we finally found our way home. Apart from stellar service during the crisis, the staff was always very helpful with recommending restaurants and booking reservations. One day Marie even gave me her own pass to the Mussee d'Orsay so I did not have to wait in a 2 hour line to get into that very popular Museum. Le Placide is located across the street from the Bon Marche, one of the largest department stores in Paris. Their grand epicierie is full of wonderful food. To the detriment of my waistline, I bought a fabulous raspberry or citron tart every day. The Rue Saint Placide is full of cute little shops and a couple of great bakeries. One can walk easily to the Ile de la Cite to see Notre Dame and it is also an easy walk to the Louvre and the Jardin de Luxembourg, the Sorbonne, Pantheon and various other sites. The rooms are modern (small when compared to US hotel rooms however way larger than most European hotel rooms which usually leave about a foot of space around the bed) and the bathroom is lovely. Good toiletries and slippers and heavy cotton bathrobes were provided -- as well as a towel warmer. There is a bench in the bedroom under which we were able to stowe our suitcases. There are two cabinets for clothes -- no dressers and at first I was worried about where all my clothes would go but in the end, it worked. There is a safe large enough for a laptop and a small flat screen TV and DVD player with movies available downstairs. The breakfast was a good continental breakfast, served with panache in the small lobby sitting area. There are approximately 2 rooms on each floor and you can either take the stairs or the very intimate elevator. I would stay again in a minute!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: amarula14
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly placed in St Germain and very near a number of metro stations. The concierge/receptionists were incredibly friendly and were very happy to recommend some local restaurants, book us a taxi etc etc. We had a room with a balcony which was small but perfectly formed! It had everything we needed (but perhaps a few more coat hangers in the wardrobe would be useful). Note, the room rate does not include breakfast and it is better value if you go out to eat rather than pay extra for the hotel breakfast. It was quiet - no need for ear plugs - and very comfy bed!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here: They'll Rip You Off”
Reviews.Author: NicaZ
Reviews.Content: Don't stay at hotel le placide in paris!!! it may get great reviews but i had an AWFUL experience. I booked a room at the hotel and then cancelled within the 5 day period in advance of my reservation. The hotel not only charged me ANYWAY but they OVERCHARGED me. Instead of 250 Euros, they charged me 300 Euros. The staff never responded to messages, never helped me when i called, and were totally unresponsive. If you want to risk the same happening, stay here. But I wouldn't.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Britty1515
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and i stayed here for our first trip to Paris. We loved how small it was and how friendly the concierge were. They had great recommendations for dinner each night. It was so nice to feel like they knew us every time we walked in. I definitely think the price was worth it for a great room in a boutique hotel and in a great area. It is across the street from Le Bon Marche and there is so much to do in the area. My only complaint is that the breakfast was an extra 20 Euros per person. I think breakfast should be included for the amount of money paid for the room, but I think it is the norm in Paris to pay extra for breakfast. In any case, the food was delicious. I will recommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here - you won't be disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: HaydenAJ
Reviews.Content: What a great stay we had at Le Placide! Stay here - you won't be disappointed. The staff were excellent and willing to do whatever was necessary to help us make the most of our stay. We arrived and were immediately made to feel welcome at at home. We stayed in an executive room (the ones with a balcony) and it was roomy, quiet and private. The location is perfect. Litterally across the street from Le Bon Marche, Le Grande Epicerie and Serves-Babylon metro station. Finding that special hotel in Paris can be stressful - look no further then Le Placide. We are already planning a return visit!

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite hotel in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Ravinroscoe
Reviews.Content: Le Placide was a terrific, luxurious getaway! I only had a few days in which to spend in Paris, and the staff made my visit a restful and extremely pleasant one. The top-floor suite was clean, elegant, and QUIET -- quite remarkable for a hotel in the heart of the Rive Gauche/6e. I slept like a baby -- no earplugs or sleep mask needed. The decor was very modern and chic -- great lighting, a deep tub for soaking, and a comfortable chair in which to sit while I read or knitted. I also liked having a balcony, though I couldn't enjoy it because of the rainy weather. (Next time!) Hiring the hotel's car service to and from the airport was a very smart thing to do -- well worth the 90 euros. As for travel around town, Le Placide is about three blocks from the Sevres-Babylone metro stop, so it's very convenient. I was very impressed with the staff's friendliness and helpfulness, and they helped me muddle through my rusty French speaking skills. I intend to return to Le Placide often -- it will be my home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: JJHGG
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location, great decor and even better staff. We travel frequently and have never felt compelled to write a review before. This hotel deserves one. We here for 8 nights with our 9 year old daughter, who became ill. The staff was simply superb, happily arranging for a doctor and helping us with medication, etc. They were also very helpful with every other aspect of our trip, recommending things to see, places to take children, parks, etc. Everyone we dealt with was first rate.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChrisLondon59
Reviews.Content: Room: We have booked one of the Junior Suites. The rather big room with great bathroom has always been very clean and everything was provided iPod station, good-sized TV, free Wi-Fi etc Tipp: I would have preferred one of the smaller Executive Rooms on the top floor with little balcony. Surely lovely in the summer time to have breakfast there. Location: Located in St. Germain des Pres south of the river it felt as an excellent choice location-wise, as great shops nice little cafe's and of course the department store Le Bon Marche is just on your door step. Tube stations are a 2 min. walk. Food: I was surprised by the standard of the food provided for breakfast. Lovely fresh bread and generally great quality food from Le Bon Marche's food hall. Enjoyed hardly ever my breakfast that much being in a hotel. The 24h meals are also above standard, but as usual overpriced. Staff: Was always very friendly and caring throughout our stay and made a great effort to speak English AND teach us some more French. The concierge/porter was always to hand when needed. Pro: - nice and stylish rooms - bathroom - good location - great food (breakfast/snacks) - friendly staff - room size for Paris - quiet Contra: - very small elevator (2 persons) - price - view from room

Reviews.Title: “Bad service - not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Monaco77
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel has nice looking bedrooms, the small size of it and the poor service doesn't justify the price. I was totally angry at the way the person at reception dealt with what was clearly a mistake on their part. I had specifically requested a top floor room with a balcony, which, along for the location, is the main reason to choose that hotel. I had a written confirmation by email and by their automatic booking system. When we arrived, the lady who was supposed to get us to our room was hastily halted by another receptionist (the manager?) who took us to our room which, once we got out of the lift was on.... the second floor. So no balcony ! When I pointed that to the guy he said "oh but you had booked a junior suite". I didn't have my paper with me so didn't figure the difference between the two kinds of rooms but found it strange. He then muttered some vague explanation about bookings etc.. and the schedule not being free for the top room when I booked! After settling down, I went back downstairs, paper in hand (retrieved from my bag) where it clearly stated the availability and confirmation of a top floor room with a balcony. I showed that to him and he once again, didn't apologize, and proceeded to say something even more vague about the booking system. He then said, oh but we upgraded you, your room is now 4 square meters bigger! Big deal! And as I was saying that I still would have preferred a smaller room, he said "but you won't be charged for the additional space"!! Thank GOd !! So basically, they made a mistake, probably handed our room to someone else and instead of apologizing and providing champagne or whatever else that could have sweetened the deal, they fed me some lies. The location, space and style of the room didn't compensate at all for this terrible welcome and I couldn't wait to get out of there. I must precise that I am French so the whole conversation was in French and there was no room for misunderstanding due to language !! My advice, try Hotel Mayet a few streets down, same good location, 3 times cheaper and adorable service. Or if you want a 4 star hotel, L'Esprit Saint Germain is lovely. I really regret not being able to stay there this time. We generally like luxury hotels and don't mind paying for it when it's worth it. In this case, definitely not !

Reviews.Title: “My home in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Nancychina
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Placide, on the begining of May 2009, and we enjoyed the great welcome that was showed to us. On the occasion our tour in Europe, there was no better place to visit musueum, or shopping. All the more, I could use the electric Solex to get fresh air, by this spring time. The breakfast was excellet and plentiful and the service very good. Our suite was pretty and we felt ourselves very comfortable as the locality provided us many occasions to get new activities and we came back to have a good rest.We appreciated the quiet during the night.All the staff was wholehearted to make our time pleasant, whether organising us a dinner-cruise on the river of the Seine, or advising on good places to have a drink in the quartier latin. This very fashionable hotel stands for a lovely house, and let us spending our stay with a good atmosphere. We spent a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Boutique Hotel In Paris”
Reviews.Author: travelzalotl
Reviews.Content: We have used Tripadvisor for years to search for hotels. This is the first time I have ever felt compelled to write a review. We had a wonderful 4 night stay at Le Placide in April. I really want to compliment the whole staff. Everyone we encountered was so helpful and we were always greeted with a smile. Our room was on the 5th floor (52) and had a lovely balcony with table and chairs. Decor was very chic, very comfortable and the location was very quiet. Metro station was only about 100 meters so very convenient. It's in an upscale residentail area with not many tourists. We had two wonderful dining experiences while in Paris. Le Comptoir and Le Bistro Henri. Kind of hard to get in but again the hotel staff assisted us in making reservations. The food was fabulous and not terribly expensive! No english on the menu's but my husband speaks alittle french so it helped. We have traveled to Paris quite often and Le Placide is now our favorite place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Charming location, charming rooms, charming service.”
Reviews.Author: NYRobin24
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at le Placide. We communicated via email before we came and the staff could not have been more helpful and kind. They booked us a wonderful restaurant for dinner--Gerard Depardieu was eating there too! They let us check in early and stay a bit past check-out time. Our room was sunny and sparkling clean and we were enchanted by the neighborhood. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: glabrop
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Le Placide for 5 days on december 2008. it is a very nice hotel in a very good location. You can walk in the evening and not be afraid of anything. The hotel manager and staff are very frendly and willing to help with anything you ask. The room (we stayed at the 4th floor) is clean and nicely decorated (missoni pillows etc.). I would definetely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “So comfortable”
Reviews.Author: AlineNassau
Reviews.Content: There are three main reasons why i stay at Le Placide;great staff and personalized service:unique, comfortable rooms and promixity to le Bon Marche( just across the street). We have stayed in many hotels in Paris but this our favourite.

Reviews.Title: “Home Sweet Home”
Reviews.Author: ibettan
Reviews.Content: I've spent 2 nights in this small hotel and really felt like at home. We were recieved by the owner of the place, a french woman named Marie, who did everything to make us fell well. The room was also very bright and comfortable. We've spend a very nice weekend in paris staying in this place which is located in the center of paris, not to far from Notre Dame, and closed to Le Bon Marche, a french department store very "chic"

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jolie111
Reviews.Content: Superb service and the room we stayed in was very chic and comfortable. Enjoyed the balcony a lot! The location is good, on the back of Rue de Bac and less than 10 mins walk from the main part of Saint Germain. Metro very close by as well. Plus less than 10 mins walk from the Rodin museum.

Reviews.Title: “excellent overall”
Reviews.Author: selomo
Reviews.Content: only positive words to Marie, Nichola, Muktar, Aline and Bertran. I spent nine nights in this boutique hotel. Charming hotel in all the confort aspects. Huge room and bathroom, bright and calm. Toilleteries Molton Brown. Breakfast with all the needs. Keep this hotel as a little jewel and you will be always successfull. Location unbeatable, Saint Germain and Bon Marché. Metro station in the corner. Lot of restaurants and shopping all around. And of course, small corners to fall in love. Recommended at all.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic personalized service”
Reviews.Author: Cherish
Reviews.Content: We booked Le Placide for our recent trip to Paris. My sister and I, and my parents had rooms on the same floor meaning we had one floor all to ourselves. The rooms are not huge but definitely comfortable and roomy enough by Parisian standards. They were clean, well appointed and pleasant. We go to Paris every year and we have stayed in hotels like the Plaza Athenee, Pvailion de la Reine and the boutique Hyatt at Malsherbes. Though all were equally good in varying degrees, Le Placide has won us over in terms of service. We felt like very welcome guests in someone's home. The location, of being in the Saint Germain area is also a definite plus. From the time we arrived ( we requested for a car to fetch us at the train station), every request we made was catered to quickly and warmly. Restaurant reservations were made on our behalf and everyone, from Madame Marie, Nicholas, Christophe and even the guy who poured coffee for breakfast was genuinely accomodating. One thing that stands out in my memory was when we requested for a taxi to wait for us at the CDG airport- we went to Spain after Paris, and we were flying in from Granada and going straight to catch the Eurostar to London, we didn't want to have to queue for a cab or take the train afraid of delays and all that. So we asked the hotel to book us a taxi for that date (note that we wouldn't be guests of the hotel by this time) We communicated via email and all was set. When we arrived the taxi was there and my phone started ringing, I didn't answer as it was an unknown number. A few minutes later, the taxi drivers phone rang, and it was the hotel asking if we were picked up. Nicholas even asked to speak to one of us to see if everything was ok. Now that is personalized service! I was really touched by that. We all agreed that we would definitely stay in Le Placide again!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful service but pricey”
Reviews.Author: allwol
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel in a great location. Good for local shopping and public transport. Very comfortable rooms (only 11 of them). Reception and service charming, friendly and very helpful. Breakfast a bit of a rip-off at €22 for a cup of tea! We stayed four nights and despite being close to the busy Rue de Sevre we found it quiet and restful. Curtain between bed and bathrooms a little disconcerting but the open plan idea gives the effect of spaciousness. Definitely over-priced

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Service !!”
Reviews.Author: tripadvisiorreview99
Reviews.Content: Great location of the Hotel. Most of it is within 10-20 minutes walking distance or a short taxi ride away. Metro Station is just around the corner. The Hotel itself is very clean and the staff is surprisingly nice and helpful. Both very unusual for Paris Hotels (even the 5 star ones). We stayed for two nights at the beginning of April 2008 in a suite on the 4th floor. The room layout is very well done, the room itself is not huge but spacious enough not to feel boxed in (as it is with so many other hotel rooms in Paris for that price). Fantastic bathroom with a bath tub, also very clean and spacious. Breakfast buffet is very good. The night attendant deserves special attention since he provided us with excellent bar & restaurant tips! (Try asking the staff in other Hotels in Paris and you will find that not even will they be unfriendly but also couldn't care less about telling you about nice evening/night spots.) After many times in Paris we finally found "our" hotel in Paris for quick getaways or extended weekends!
